planner_edit_plan: Redraw only the lamp head to show a clearly defined streetlight fixture (housing and lens) and replace the overbright blob with a subtle warm glow plus a tiny halo confined to the lamp head pixels, with no added light cast on surrounding road/scene and no exposure change elsewhere.
critic_notes: Edit does not follow the plan: the streetlight luminaire itself is not redrawn with a clearly defined fixture (housing/lens); instead a bright glowing orb is added at the top of a pole. The glow is too large and reads like an added light source rather than a subtle lamp-head-only glow, and it appears to introduce a global exposure/contrast shift (scene looks slightly darker/greener) beyond the target pixels. To fix: keep the original scene identical, redraw only the lamp head geometry (small fixture shape) and confine a warm glow + tiny halo strictly within/just around the lamp head pixels with no spill or overall relighting.
